page.title: 17The Blacksmith
page.content: The village Blacksmith Mr.Charles Page died in 1982. His daughter,Jean Page, still lives in the cottage adjoining the smithy. Jean Page is the Chairman of the Parish Council and was interviewed by a group of children, who she had invited to visit her home.She is a teacher, not at St.Andrew's.She told them all about her father's life. The smithy has been in the Page family since 1811 and possibly longer. Charles Page worked very hard and travelled around quite a lot,covering an area between Newport and Nazeing. Right up until he retired he was kept busy,due to the revival in horse riding.He had as many as 60 horses to shoe in Hadham alone. Miss Page is converting the Smithy into a museum of the blacksmith trade and this work is still in progress.
